info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 1 at 8:56PM CDT until May 2 at 10:39AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville affecting Hunt County.
South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan affecting Rockwall and Hunt Counties.
Big Sandy Creek Near Bridgeport affecting Wise County.
West Fork Trinity River Near Jacksboro affecting Jack County.
Denton Creek Near Justin affecting Denton County.
Trinity River At Dallas affecting Dallas County.
Trinity River Near Long Lake (Oakwood) affecting Anderson, Leon and Freestone Counties.
Brazos River Near South Bend affecting Young County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
West Fork Trinity River Near Boyd affecting Wise County.
Trinity River At Trinidad affecting Henderson and Navarro Counties.
...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Texas...
Chambers Creek Near Rice affecting Navarro County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...Cowleech Fork Sabine River at Greenville.
* WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Caution should be exercised near the river as water begins to flow out of the banks.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 4.4 feet Tuesday evening.
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.water.noaa.gov/wfo/FWD.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING
